channel.title: Looking
channel.description: Runescape Classic Server Source Plus client All quests working All skills working No added items Quest requirements for items met The original server please F2p/P2p I'd like the tool to edit items an map If anyone out their has any info on how to get my hands on the tools it would be nice :)

item.title: Looking
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“waj, post:7, topic:544613”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=663488.msg4434449#msg4434449 date=1404568028]

[quote author=Schaffer link=topic=663488.msg4434414#msg4434414 date=1404540228]errors…[/quote]What errors? Are you doing what the README says to do?
[/quote]
Since when did anyone around here actually read that thing?

Everyone complains the mopar source has errors because there too damn lazy to actually read.[/quote]Ya, I’m not sure what to do to make it easier… I guess the commits I merged today are on the right track by making it more readable/friendly, but other than that I have no idea on how to get people to actually read documentation.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

The closest you’re going to get is MoparClassic. Which can be found here: https://github.com/Lothy/MoparClassic

Read full topic

item.title: Looking
item.dc:creator: @Schaffer Schaffer
item.description:
@Schaffer wrote:

I have mess around with easy rsc is cool.
I’d just like the original source to rsc.
I’ve seen alot of source out their an some are mostly dead links
Doesnt have to have rune crafting just when rs2 came out an rsc went to the shit as far as jagex.
Just looking for a plain clean copy. I can start learning by editing it my self.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking
item.dc:creator: @stEps stEps
item.description:
@stEps wrote:

you would most likely have to search for some stuff. Most people don’t just hand you all their work in a basket and send you on your way. It’s a big learning process, maybe you should start with Easyrsc (try searching it).

Read full topic
